Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

question.title: What is the term for the diagnosis of migraine, facial vascular pain, and trigeminal neuralgia?
question.description: From a video interview, evoke the diagnosis of migraine, facial vascular pain, trigeminal neuralgia.

option_a.title: Trigeminal neuralgia syndrome
option_a.description: A condition characterized by severe facial pain, often triggered by light touch or movement.

option_b.title: Migraine with aura
option_b.description: A type of migraine that is accompanied by neurological symptoms such as visual disturbances or numbness.

option_c.title: Facial vascular headache
option_c.description: A type of headache that is caused by inflammation of the blood vessels in the face.

option_d.title: Trigeminal neuralgia diagnosis
option_d.description: A term that refers to the process of diagnosing trigeminal neuralgia, a condition that affects the trigeminal nerve.
